dataset.title: CGR03 Effects of Spring Burning on Grasshopper Nymphs (1982)

address.deliveryPoint: 116 Ackert Hall, Division of Biology, Kansas State University

section.para: Sweep samples were taken for grasshoppers (Arcididae) at two upland sites on 5 watersheds at approximately two week intervals, June-Sept 1982. At each site on each occasion, 20 sets of 20 sweeps (400 sweeps total) were taken. Stored data include for each site on each occasion: total number of each species (all instars combined) collected and total number for each instar for each species (400 sweeps combined).

dataTable.entityName: CGR031 Data on the environmental variables
dataTable.entityDescription: Data on the environmental variables for grasshopper sampling on each site including soil type, windy speed, ground temperature, relative humidity, and cloudy cover.

attribute.attributeDefinition: wind speed at start of sampling (mean of 5 measurements taken at 30 second intervals; 5' above ground.
air temperature at start of sampling
relative humidity at ground level in shade at outset of sampling determined by wet/dry bulb psychrometer.
%cloud cover directly overhead at start of sampling, estimated by eye.

dataTable.entityName: CGR032 Data on the individual sweeps of each grasshopper species
dataTable.entityDescription: Data was recorded on the individual number of each grasshopper species in each set. 20 sets were designed at each site and 20 sweeps were taken in each set. This dataset was about the first 10 sets at each sample site.

attribute.attributeDefinition: row id in file (internal book keeping)

dataTable.entityName: CGR033 Data on the individual sweeps 2 of each grasshopper species
dataTable.entityDescription: Data was recorded on the individual number of each grasshopper species in each set. This dataset was about the set from No.11 to No. 20 set at each sample site.

attribute.attributeDefinition: row id in file (internal book keeping)
total number of individuals in all samples

dataTable.entityName: CGR034 Data on the individual instar of each grasshopper species
dataTable.entityDescription: Data was recorded on the individual number of instar and adult stage. Instars were classified into first, second, third, fourth, and fifth stage. Adult was identified with sex (male and female).

attribute.attributeDefinition: row id in file (internal book keeping)
number of individuals of adult females
number of individuals of adult males
total number of ind./all stages 400 sweeps

stmml:unit.name: time in military hours and minutes
stmml:unit.id: time in military hours and minutes
